entry.title: Simulating Lifespan (Why do blobs die around age 2?)

media:group.media:title: Simulating Lifespan (Why do blobs die around age 2?)
media:group.media:description: Took me longer to figure this out than I thought. But as promised... here's why blobs are on average 2 days old... ___________________________________________ ➡ Links Graphs and code from this video: https://codesandbox.io/s/blob-age-pbf1r?file=/src/index.js Evolution Simulator: https://labs.minutelabs.io/evolution-simulator Primer's original video: https://youtu.be/0ZGbIKd0XrM ___________________________________________ ➡ Support Donate on GitHub Sponsors: https://github.com/sponsors/wellcaffe... Subscribe on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/minutelabsio ___________________________________________ ➡ Credits Video by: Jasper Palfree With Contributions From: The MinuteEarth Team Special thanks to Primer ___________________________________________ ➡ Music - "The Plan's Working" by Cooper Cannell - "Investigations" by Kevin Macleod - "Five Card Shuffle" by Kevin Macleod - "Sneaky Snitch" by Kevin Macleod - "Wholesome" by Kevin Macleod - "Divider" by Chris Zabriskie http://chriszabriskie.com/divider/

entry.title: Proximity Graphs with Gravity | Let's Build a Physics Simulation

media:group.media:title: Proximity Graphs with Gravity | Let's Build a Physics Simulation
media:group.media:description:
Playing around with gravity, anti-gravity, and elastic forces!
Start with this: https://playcode.io/666098
Finished Product: https://playcode.io/658580
If you haven't seen the pong video, check it out here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gNA6HKRWAI0
Visit MinuteLabs.io for more interactives and simulations! https://minutelabs.io ---- Donate
If you get something out of the work I do, consider sponsoring me on either:
Github Sponsors: https://github.com/sponsors/wellcaffeinated Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/minutelabsio
---- Contents
00:00 Introduction 01:52 Making a higher DPI canvas 04:43 Creating a bunch of nodes 15:40 Min-Max Normalization with lerp() 21:57 Connecting the dots (nodes) 27:12 Distance dependency (the proximity part) 29:54 Fun stuff to try 31:00 Colouring the connections with rescale() 36:14 Minimum distance threshold 37:09 Smoother animation with requestAnimationFrame() 41:16 Faster line drawing 43:54 Adding forces 48:15 Elastic forces 49:50 Gravity 53:32 Parting thoughts
--- Music
"Land of the RetroOnes" by RAGE "Local Forecast - Elevator Music" by Kevin Macleod

entry.title: Let’s Build a Physics Simulation (PONG: Part 2)

media:group.media:title: Let’s Build a Physics Simulation (PONG: Part 2)
media:group.media:description:
We finish building our version of PONG! Find Part 1 here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gNA6HKRWAI0
Finished Product: https://playcode.io/642557/
----
If you get something out of the work I do, consider sponsoring me on either: Github Sponsors: https://github.com/sponsors/wellcaffeinated Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/minutelabsio
---- Contents
00:00 Introduction 00:56 Using vectors for collisions 23:13 Making paddles 32:48 Moving the paddles with the keyboard 44:31 Paddle collisions 53:20 Scoreboard 1:05:51 Conclusion

entry.title: Let’s Build a Physics Simulation (PONG: Part 1)

media:group.media:title: Let’s Build a Physics Simulation (PONG: Part 1)
media:group.media:description:
Join me in building a physics simulation from scratch!
Part 2: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zlKXZiWE1XI
Start here: https://playcode.io
Vector Library URL: https://labs.minutelabs.io/toolkit/js/vector.js
Finished Product: https://playcode.io/642557/
---- Tutorial recommendation for programming beginners: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6NZfCO5SIk ----
If you get something out of the work I do, consider sponsoring me on either: Github Sponsors: https://github.com/sponsors/wellcaffeinated Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/minutelabsio
---- Contents
00:00 Introduction 01:35 Getting Started 03:31 Creating an HTML Canvas 06:48 Drawing a circle 11:47 Color Trick for CodePlay 12:51 Making things move (Animation Loop) 18:43 Getting things smooth (Framerate Adjustment) 21:40 Our first physics equation 24:19 Using Vectors 30:15 Bouncing off the walls (Edge Collisions) 36:51 Cleaning up a bit 39:52 What's to come in Part 2

media:group.media:title: Interactive Evolution Simulator
media:group.media:description:
"Evolution Simulator": https://labs.minutelabs.io/evolution-simulator
In collaboration with Primer, I built an interactive version of his "Simulating Natural Selection" video!
Primer's original video: https://youtu.be/0ZGbIKd0XrM ___________________________________________ Support: Donate on GitHub Sponsors: https://github.com/sponsors/wellcaffeinated Subscribe on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/minutelabsio ___________________________________________ Credits: Video by: Jasper Palfree Illustrations: Sarah Berman With Contributions From: The MinuteEarth Team ___________________________________________ Music: - "What True Self? Feels Bogus, Let's Watch Jason X" by Chris Zabriskie - "Candlepower" by Chris Zabriskie - "Divider" by Chris Zabriskie - "The Plan's Working" by Cooper Cannell - "CGI Snake" by Chris Zabriskie http://chriszabriskie.com/divider/

entry.title: Dragon vs. Airplane - Which Is Faster?

media:group.media:title: Dragon vs. Airplane - Which Is Faster?
media:group.media:description:
"Flight Speed": https://labs.minutelabs.io/flight-speed/
This app lets you compare the minimum speed various flying things need to have to stay in the air.
Thanks also to our Patreon patrons https://www.patreon.com/minutelabsio ___________________________________________ The Best Dragon (According to Science): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3n1DC_Q-2Ng ___________________________________________ Credits: Video by: Jasper Palfree Illustrations: Sarah Berman & Ever Salazar With Contributions From: The MinuteEarth Team ___________________________________________ Music from https://filmmusic.io "Scheming Weasel (slower version)" by Kevin MacLeod (https://incompetech.com) License: CC BY (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/)

entry.title: This lab took me 6 years to release

media:group.media:title: This lab took me 6 years to release
media:group.media:description:
"What is a Day?": http://labs.minutelabs.io/what-is-a-day/
I built an interactive video to explain what a "day" is... it's not as obvious as you may think.
Thanks also to our Patreon patrons https://www.patreon.com/minutelabsio ___________________________________________ Cool interactive stuff: ROME http://www.ro.me/
The Wilderness Downtown http://thewildernessdowntown.com
Ben & Grant's Quaternion Interactive Videos https://eater.net/quaternions ___________________________________________ Credits: Script Writer, Narrator, & Video Director: Jasper Palfree Illustrations: Arcadi Garcia & Ever Salazar With Contributions From: The MinuteEarth Team
Music: Divider by Chris Zabriskie http://chriszabriskie.com/divider/

entry.title: The Ultimate Tree of Life App...?

media:group.media:title: The Ultimate Tree of Life App...?
media:group.media:description:
Tree of Life Explorer: https://labs.minutelabs.io/Tree-of-Life-Explorer
We couldn't find an app that drew the kinds of evolutionary trees we wanted, so we built one!
"You are a Fish" on MinuteEarth - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yyeDgBm1Du8
Thanks also to our Patreon patrons https://www.patreon.com/minutelabsio and our YouTube members. ___________________________________________
Other Tree of Life Apps
Open Tree of Life - https://tree.opentreeoflife.org One Zoom - http://www.onezoom.org iTOL - http://itol.embl.de/itol.cgi Evogeneao - https://www.evogeneao.com/explore/tree-of-life-explorer _________________________________________
Credits: Script Writers, Narrators, & Video Directors: Ever Salazar & Jasper Palfree Video Illustrator: Ever Salazar With Contributions From: Henry Reich, Alex Reich, Kate Yoshida, Peter Reich, David Goldenberg
